title: (x) Downtown Deli - Quicksilver (Neon Lights) {Chesh, Mark S}
content:
Can someone help me identify this font? thanks! ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24708.jpg)

(x) Downtown Deli - Quicksilver (Neon Lights)

 [‹ from: Atelier David Smith](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46332 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Tubular "Losma" - Quicksilver {Tim} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12498 "Go to next forum topic")
author: julia

comments.content:
Here's another [chromium rounded geometric sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/chromium-one/chromium-one/testdrive.html?s=DOWNTOWN%20DELI&p=48). I seem   
remember this one from old rub-down lettering catalogues,   
but don't ask me its name...

That's [Neon Lights](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nb_ppp=40&texte=DOWNTOWN&nq=1&q=neon), and it's free. For my money, however, I like Letraset's [Chromium 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.letraset.com/us/template1a.asp?catid=60&id=341) better.

The font is also known as [Quicksilver](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.free-fonts.com/cgi-bin1/fsearch.pl?search=Quicksilver) & [Quantum](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.free-fonts.com/cgi-bin1/fsearch.pl?search=Quantum)
Quicksilver is the original Letraset name for it. Chromium One is a different Letraset font along similar lines.
It also appears that Letraset's Quicksilver is only available in the form of crummy unauthorized free fonts.
Yup, an unfortunate fate for quite a few typefaces it seems...

Dean Morris, the designer of Quicksilver was kind enough to give us a history of it here:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=22838](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=22838 "http://www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=22838")

So I’ve dug up this old thread to share it with you.

P.S. Once upon a time Bitstream had digitized it — also, OPTIFONTS had it.

as i mention in a couple other locations, i’m posting on flickr examples of quicksilver i collected with more to come.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27088565@N07/sets/72157605297772027/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080828033449/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/27088565@N07/sets/72157605297772027/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/27088565@N07/sets/72157605297772027/")
